task.title: Adding custom headers and footers
task.shortdesc: You add a custom header to include a publication title, company logo, or other common branding elements in HTML output. A custom footer can also be added with copyright information, legal boilerplate, or other fine print.

context.p: In HTML5 output, the contents of the header file will be wrapped in an HTML5 header element with the role attribute set to banner.
For example, the DITA-OT documentation includes a simple header banner with the publication title and a horizontal rule to separate the header from the generated topic content:
context.note: Header and footer files should be specified using absolute paths and must contain valid XML. A common practice is to place all content into a div element.

step.cmd: Set args.hdr to include an XML file as a running header that appears above the page content.
Set args.ftr to include an XML file as a running footer that appears below the page content.
Add custom CSS rules to style headers and/or footers.
